The USGBC Detroit Region Green Schools Committee is proud to announce that the Winner of our "Best Use of Green Principles" Special Award at the Engineering Society of Detroit's Future City Competition is: Comstock STEM Academy from Kalamazoo, MI.

Future City Competition is a project-based learning program where students in 6th, 7th, and 8th grades imagine, research, design, and build cities of the future. The local competition is sponsored by the The Engineering Society of Detroit, and the award was presented on Tuesday, January 28th, 2020!

To our Judges: Teri, Harold, Anthony, Cynthia and Peggy, thank you again for donating your time to review all the projects and select our winner!

Thank you to Harold Wilcox, who presented our Best Use of Green Principles Award to the winning team. Congratulations to the students from Comstock STEM Academy on a great project!

In honor of Black History Month, KPL is recognizing local African Americans, both past and present, who made or are making a difference in Kalamazoo. Thank you to SHARE for your part in this project!

Charles Pratt
Practiced law in Kalamazoo from 1935 to 1968.
Elected Michigan Eighth District Judge in Kalamazoo.
Re-elected 1974 to 1980.
President of Kalamazoo County Bar Association, County Legal Aid Bureau (which he helped organize.) Kalamazoo NAACP, Kalamazoo Lions Club, Kalamazoo Torch Club.
Member of boards of Douglass Community Association, Kalamazoo YMCA, Youth Opportunities Unlimited, Greater Kalamazoo United Way, and many others.
